meanings.definition: A hormone that stimulates the absorption of sodium by the kidneys and regulates salt and water balance in the body.
meanings.sent1: Aldosterone helps the body control the amount of salt and water it has.
meanings.sent2: The kidneys rely on aldosterone to manage sodium levels effectively.
meanings.sent3: When aldosterone throws a pool party in the kidneys, everyone wants to join in for a salty splash!
meanings.sent4: In the body's sodium balancing act, aldosterone plays the role of the strict director.
meanings.sent5: Imagine aldosterone as a diligent gatekeeper, allowing only the right amount of sodium to enter.
